segment.source: Known issues with UWP on Xbox One developer preview
segment.target: Known issues with UWP on Xbox One developer preview

segment.source: Known issues with UWP on Xbox developer preview
segment.target: Known issues with UWP on Xbox developer preview

segment.source: This topic describes known issues with the UWP on Xbox developer preview.
segment.target: This topic describes known issues with the UWP on Xbox developer preview.

segment.source: For more information about this developer preview, see UWP on Xbox.
segment.target: For more information about this developer preview, see UWP on Xbox.

segment.source: If you came here from a link in an API reference topic, and are looking for Universal device family API information, please see UWP features that aren't yet supported on Xbox.
segment.target: If you came here from a link in an API reference topic, and are looking for Universal device family API information, please see UWP features that aren't yet supported on Xbox.

segment.source: The Xbox Developer Preview System Update includes experimental and early pre-release software.
segment.target: The Xbox Developer Preview System Update includes experimental and early pre-release software.

segment.source: This means that some popular games and apps will not work as expected, and you may experience occasional crashes and data loss.
segment.target: This means that some popular games and apps will not work as expected, and you may experience occasional crashes and data loss.

segment.source: If you leave the developer preview, your console will factory reset and you will have to reinstall all of your games, apps, and content.
segment.target: If you leave the developer preview, your console will factory reset and you will have to reinstall all of your games, apps, and content.

segment.source: For developers, this means that not all developer tools and APIs will function as expected.
segment.target: For developers, this means that not all developer tools and APIs will function as expected.

segment.source: Not all features intended for the final release are included or are at release quality.
segment.target: Not all features intended for the final release are included or are at release quality.

segment.source: In particular, system performance in this preview does not reflect system performance of the final release.
segment.target: In particular, system performance in this preview does not reflect system performance of the final release.

segment.source: The following list highlights some known issues that you might encounter in this release, but this list is not exhaustive.
segment.target: The following list highlights some known issues that you might encounter in this release, but this list is not exhaustive.

segment.source: We want to get your feedback, so please report any issues that you find on the Developing Universal Windows apps forum.
segment.target: We want to get your feedback, so please report any issues that you find on the Developing Universal Windows apps forum.

segment.source: If you get stuck, read the information in this topic, see Frequently asked questions, and use the forums to ask for help.
segment.target: If you get stuck, read the information in this topic, see Frequently asked questions, and use the forums to ask for help.

segment.source: Developing games
segment.target: Developing games

segment.source: Mouse mode support
segment.target: Mouse mode support

segment.source: For information about mouse mode support, see the Designing for Xbox and TV topic.
segment.target: For information about mouse mode support, see the Designing for Xbox and TV topic.

segment.source: This topic includes information about how to enable and disable mouse mode, so you can choose the right behavior for your app.
segment.target: This topic includes information about how to enable and disable mouse mode, so you can choose the right behavior for your app.

segment.source: DirectX 12 support
segment.target: DirectX 12 support

segment.source: UWP on Xbox One supports DirectX 11 Feature Level 10.
segment.target: UWP on Xbox One supports DirectX 11 Feature Level 10.

segment.source: DirectX 12 is not supported at this time.
segment.target: DirectX 12 is not supported at this time.

segment.source: Xbox One, like all traditional games consoles, is a specialized piece of hardware that requires a specific SDK to access its full potential.
segment.target: Xbox One, like all traditional games consoles, is a specialized piece of hardware that requires a specific SDK to access its full potential.

segment.source: If you are working on a game that requires access to the maximum potential of the Xbox One hardware, you can register with the ID@XBOX program to get access to that SDK, which includes DirectX 12 support.
segment.target: If you are working on a game that requires access to the maximum potential of the Xbox One hardware, you can register with the ID@XBOX program to get access to that SDK, which includes DirectX 12 support.

segment.source: Known issue with the TV safe area
segment.target: Known issue with the TV safe area

segment.source: By default, the display area for UWP apps on Xbox should be inset by the TV safe area.
segment.target: By default, the display area for UWP apps on Xbox should be inset by the TV safe area.

segment.source: However, the Xbox One Developer Preview contains a known bug that causes the TV safe area to start at [0, 0] rather than at [offset, offset].
segment.target: However, the Xbox One Developer Preview contains a known bug that causes the TV safe area to start at [0, 0] rather than at [offset, offset].

segment.source: For more information about the TV safe area, see Designing for Xbox and TV.
segment.target: For more information about the TV safe area, see Designing for Xbox and TV.

segment.source: The easiest way to work around this issue is to disable the TV safe area, as shown in the following JavaScript example.
segment.target: The easiest way to work around this issue is to disable the TV safe area, as shown in the following JavaScript example.

segment.source: Networking using traditional sockets
segment.target: Networking using traditional sockets

segment.source: In this developer preview, inbound and outbound network access from the console that uses traditional TCP/UDP sockets (WinSock, Windows.Networking.Sockets) is not available.
segment.target: In this developer preview, inbound and outbound network access from the console that uses traditional TCP/UDP sockets (WinSock, Windows.Networking.Sockets) is not available.

segment.source: Developers can still use HTTP and WebSockets.
segment.target: Developers can still use HTTP and WebSockets.

segment.source: UWP API coverage
segment.target: UWP API coverage

segment.source: Not all UWP APIs work as intended on Xbox in this preview.
segment.target: Not all UWP APIs work as intended on Xbox in this preview.

segment.source: See UWP features that aren't yet supported on Xbox for the list of APIs that we know don’t work.
segment.target: See UWP features that aren't yet supported on Xbox for the list of APIs that we know don’t work.

segment.source: If you find issues with other APIs, please report them on the forums.
segment.target: If you find issues with other APIs, please report them on the forums.

segment.source: Windows Device Portal (WDP) preview
segment.target: Windows Device Portal (WDP) preview

segment.source: WDP UI does not display correctly in Internet Explorer 7
segment.target: WDP UI does not display correctly in Internet Explorer 7

segment.source: By default, WDP UI does not display correctly in the browser when using Internet Explorer 7.
segment.target: By default, WDP UI does not display correctly in the browser when using Internet Explorer 7.

segment.source: You can fix this by turning off Internet Explorer 7’s Compatibility View for WDP.
segment.target: You can fix this by turning off Internet Explorer 7’s Compatibility View for WDP.

segment.source: Navigating to WDP causes a certificate warning
segment.target: Navigating to WDP causes a certificate warning

segment.source: You will receive a warning about the certificate that was provided, similar to the following screenshot, because the security certificate signed by your Xbox One console is not considered a well-known trusted publisher.
segment.target: You will receive a warning about the certificate that was provided, similar to the following screenshot, because the security certificate signed by your Xbox One console is not considered a well-known trusted publisher.

segment.source: Click "Continue to this website" to access the Windows Device Portal.
segment.target: Click "Continue to this website" to access the Windows Device Portal.

segment.source: Website security certificate warning
segment.target: Website security certificate warning

segment.target: See also
